info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 7:46AM EDT until June 14 at 8:30AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... McDowell County in western North Carolina... Northwestern Rutherford County in western North Carolina... East central Buncombe County in western North Carolina... Southeastern Yancey County in western North Carolina... Southwestern Burke County in western North Carolina... * Until 830 AM EDT. * At 746 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles west of Morganton to 9 miles southwest of Spruce Pine, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Marion, Black Mountain, Swannanoa, Glen Alpine, Old Fort, Lake James State Park, Mount Mitchell State Park, Lake James, Montreat, and a portion of the Blue Ridge Parkway from Craggy To Little Switzerland. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
